Fields.DialogueText: Cleaning your guns again, Boise?
I've got to do something when we're not fighting Morganas.
Did you need something?

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to see what you were doing.
You're not the only one looking for something to do.
No, just bored.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, now you see it. Anything else?
Heh. Well, I'm sure you've got your own guns to clean.
Only boring people get bored.
So, why are you...
*ALARM*
Finally! It feels like I've been waiting forever for that alarm. Let's go kick some Morgana butt!
@BATTLE
No. Sorry if I'm annoying you.
You're not. I just prefer to do this kind of stuff alone.
I guess I could do that. It seems to be working for you.
It always does.
Aren't you bored right now?
No, of course not. I'm cleaning my guns. What could be boring about that?
Oh, hello, Boise. How's it going?
*grunt*
That bad?
I'm going to run out of cotton swabs before I run out of dirty guns. Again.
So, I wanted to ask you before - why are you always cleaning your guns in your free time?
What do you mean? What else would I be doing?

Fields.MenuText: You could get to know the crew.
You could spend a little more time with me.
I don't know, isn't there anything else you like to do?

Fields.DialogueText: I know the crew plenty. They're here and they help me fight Morganas. All I need to know.
Oh, yeah, 'cause that sounds sooooo exciting. I think I'll pass.
Seriously. What are you thinking about when you work on those guns? I see you watching the shoreline all the time...
Well, there's hiking, and fishing, and shooting, and no one can match me when it comes to hunting.
Unfortunately, it's a little hard to do any of that stuff when we're cruising through the ocean. You know what I mean?
Yeah, I get it. Maybe it's time to open yourself up to new experiences.
Right now, all I'm interested in is opening fire on these Morganas.
Always ready for a fight, aren't you?
Come on. There's no point cleaning these guns if I don't get them dirty again.
@BATTLE
Well, that's creepy. If you're spending your time spying on me, maybe you're the one who needs a hobby.
It's not creepy to pay attention if you're the captain of a ship that's daydreaming about taking nature hikes.
... Good guess.
Hiking?
Hiking, and fishing, and shooting - and, for the record, no one can match me when it comes to hunting.
Boise, what are you doing with that telescope?
I'm hunting.
For?
Preferably Morganas. But at this point I'm not picky.
Hunt and destroy is now the name of the game.

Fields.MenuText: I thought the name of the game was V...
Hmmm, is that a Morgana there on the horizon?
I guess we have to fight them anyway, don't we?

Fields.DialogueText: Huh? Did you say something, Captain?
What?! Where? I don't see anything!
Exactly, and if they're out there, I'll find them.
We've got Morganas coming in from the west, Captain!
See, I knew I'd find them.
Weren't you looking east?
Well, east eventually becomes west. Let's go already!
@BATTLE
Nope, just mumbling to myself. Don't mind me.
Well, do that somewhere else. You're distracting me.
I'm glad you're on our side, then.
Everyone is. I'm the best.
Calm down - I was joking. No need to fall over the edge looking.
Mhmmmm, you're so funny, Captain. Go share the laughs with someone else.
Captain, do you think we could drop anchor over there?
By that island?
Uh huh.
The one covered in trees and mountains with no apparent harbor nor any immediate signs of humanity?
Exactly.

Fields.MenuText: Sure.
No, we can't make port without a port.
Why exactly would we make port there?

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I thought you'd put up more of a fight.
That's a useless rule if I've ever heard one. You're no fun.
I want to stretch my legs a little.
It seems like a perfect place for a hike. You could join me.
We can at least try! I bet I can get my human body farther away than you think I can!
Captain, Morganas!
Looks like your hike will have to wait.
Never mind the hike. Didn't you hear? Morganas!
@BATTLE
Boise... the water here isn't that deep. There's no way we can get close enough to shore for you to get out without getting you stuck.
Boise...
There you are. How's our ship's Belle today?
Boise, are you okay?
I'm fiiine.

Fields.MenuText: You don't sound fiiine.
Okay, carry on, then.
Is this about the hiking thing?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I'm not. Obviously.
Are you dumb? I'm clearly not okay!
Yes, it's about the hiking thing! Hmph.
This is the worst thing ever. I can't believe I can't even get off the ship long enough for a good hike.
You got off a little bit.
Great, so I can walk around the boat. What am I gonna do with that? Run laps?
Not being able to hike isn't the end of the world.
It's not just that. If I can't get away from the ship, then I can't do anything else either. I guess I never realized how tethered to the ship I am.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. At least I can still do one thing I love. See ya on the battlefield, Captain.
Hmmm, maybe there's something I can do to help her.
@BATTLE
You called for me. What do you want?
Yeah, I have something for you.
... What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: I got you a gift.
This would be the perfect time for Morganas to attack, wouldn't it?
Are you... gripping your guns?

Fields.DialogueText: Why?
I think that's the oddest thing I've ever heard you say.
Maybe. Answer the question.
I saw that you were upset about not getting to do anything you liked. So I hoped this would help.
A fishing rod?
Yes.
You think I don't have a fishing rod?
Oh, in that case you can consider it more symbolic.
What do you mean?
Any time you want, you can let me know and we can find a nice beach or somewhere to make port so you can fish a little.
*Any* time?
Within reason.
That's nice... I guess. Thanks.
So, do you not want the rod?
I didn't say that.
Well, take it or don't. We won't be able to use it to fight these Morganas.
You're just not creative enough, Captain.
@BATTLE
I just mean that would probably be the best present for you.
Heh. You're probably right.
Wait, does that mean you got me a present?
Yes, I did.
I just got you a gift, that's all.
That's... not a gun you're polishing, is it?
What was the first clue, Captain? The lack of gun powder and oil, or the fact that it's made of wood?
I see your point. So... ah, is that your real fishing rod?
Mm-hm. The one you gave me was nice and all, but this one is my baby.

Fields.MenuText: It looks a little odd.
Is it old? It looks like it's got a crack in it.
Are you sure that's a fishing rod? It looks more like driftwood.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's because it's not just a fishing rod. I can also fold it in like this, and it becomes a walking stick.
It's not a crack. That's where I bend it so I can use it as a walking stick.
I'll admit, it's a little dirty. And that's why I'm cleaning it.
So, I take this to mean you'd like us to make port soon so you can try it out?
You read my mind.
... Okay, obviously it's going to wait until...
Yeah, of course we're fighting the Morganas. It's what I live for.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, Captain!
Today the prey is coming to us!
... I guess it's nice seeing you happy.
@BATTLE
Ah, this is a nice way to relax after that battle, Captain. The fish are really biting today!
Maybe for you. I didn't know it was possible to catch that many fish in one sitting.
You caught one, too. That's not bad for a beginner.

Fields.MenuText: I've fished before.
I guess you have a point.
Excuse me, I'm an expert fisherman.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you know that sometimes there are good days and bad days.
I always have a point. And a gun too.
Well, you could've fooled me with that puny fish you caught.
Does it even count if I had to throw it back? It was so small that it would've fit in one of your fish's mouths.
Heh, if I had caught it, it would've ended up in my mouth.
Now that you mention it, I am getting hungry.
Yeah, me too. Let's head back to the ship and start cooking these fish.
I hope the crew's in the mood for seafood.
Well, this is a bad day, then.
It was pretty small, wasn't it?
Well, well. What have we here?
Hm?
More fish, Boise?
Yup, quite a haul, huh, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I'll say. Are there any fish left in the ocean?
We won't be going hungry, that's for sure.
I've seen bigger.

Fields.DialogueText: I had to leave a few. Otherwise, I'd have nothing to catch next time.
Nope, though some of the sharks might.
Well, that just gives me something to aim for next time.
Are we going to have enough room for all this?
We'll do our best to make room.
Don't worry. I'll help stuff our storerooms full of fish.
Captain, Boise, we've got Morganas north of us.
What are we waiting for? Let's go get 'em! We gotta earn this dinner!
You heard the lady - let's go. Boise, you can join us on the bridge after you put the fish away.
Aw, man.
@BATTLE
Officer Cho?
Captain.
Don't just stand there looking uncomfortable. Are you looking for me?
Captain, I was hoping to talk to you for a moment.

Fields.MenuText: I'm busy.
Sure, come in.
Is this important?

Fields.DialogueText: Please, it's important, Captain.
Thank you, Captain.
Yes, very.
It's about all the fish you've been bringing back lately.
The fish?
Yes. Some of the crew have started complaining.
Why? They're good fish. Better than a lot of things we could be eating.
They're not complaining about eating it, Captain.
Boise has been catching so many lately, that we haven't been able to adequately store it all. It's starting to smell.
Ah. Yes, I could see why that would be a problem.
Exactly.
If we're overstocked, just toss some overboard.
We tried, but Boise wouldn't let us. She said she worked hard to catch the fish and she didn't want them to go to waste.
I'll talk to her. We can't have the entire ship smelling like rotten fish.
Thank you, Captain.
Captain! We've got a fight coming our way. Let's go!
I'll sound the alarm.
Thank you, Officer. Let's fight the Morganas until they smell worse than we do.
@BATTLE
All right, fine. Come in. Tell me what's wrong.
Okay. Start talking.
So, what's going on?
*ALARM*
Ahem.
No matter what anybody said, I didn't hit anybody that didn't deserve it.
That's incredibly reassuring.
Okay. So... what do you want this time?

Fields.MenuText: It's "What do you want this time, Captain?"
I just needed to talk to you for a second, Boise.
I'll tell you what I don't want. That attitude.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay. So what do you want?
About?
All right. I'll leave then.
You caught way too many fish.
Too many fish? That sounds like the opposite of a problem.
Oh, agreed. Or, at worst, it's a manageable problem.
@BATTLE
We need to talk.
The fish.
Wait. We need to talk.
But I am curious about the how.
How, what?
How you catch all the fish.
It's called a fishing rod. See, there's this hook at the end of a line, and...
Yeah, but you're not the only person on this ship who fishes. You just happen to catch 99% of the total haul.
I'm not cheating! I can't help it if I just know where the fish are gathering!
No. It's not your fault at all.
Right. Good, then. Good talk.
I just find it interesting that when you're relaxed and attentive you're sensitive enough to track clusters of fish to the inch...
... but when you're stressing out you look for Morganas in the east when they're coming from the west.
... What?
Think about it.
By the way, we have more fish than we can store. You need to either start throwing some of them back or eating a hell of a lot more.
See? Manageable problem!
... I mean, it kinda sounds like cheating when I say it out loud, but it's not my fault that everybody else is half-blind!
Okay. You're still at it.
It's disturbing, but I'm finding it kind of hard to look away.
*chomp chomp* You want me to relax? I'm relaxing.
*And* eating a hell of a lot more fish, as I recall someone demanding. Keep 'em coming!

Fields.MenuText: Boise, you don't have to do this.
Yeah, let's keep this train moving!
Whatever works for you, I guess. Do you need a bib or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I do, too! We can't just toss it out. It needs to be useful.
That's the spirit, Captain!
You don't have to pretend no to be impressed, Cap. You're not fooling anybody anyway.
The crew's getting their share too, I see.
It's turning into a party, really. I'm amazed at how many jury-rigged grills people managed to put together.
And that'll be the end of the fish crisis?
Well... it'll be much reduced, anyway.
*munch crunch* "Crisis." Come on, people! This isn't any kind of... ugghghghugh... no... I'm good. More food.
Maybe we should get you a bucket. You know, just in case.
I'll get *you* a bucket.
What does that even mean?
It means you.... Crap. Morganas incoming!
What? Really? Where?
@BATTLE
From the east. Duh!
So. Is this the last of the fish, then?
Yep. The rest of the crew wussed out, so more for Boise!
Just four left, Cap. The woman can eat.
Well, when this is done, it's back to processed meat from cans, right? So I'm gonna live in the moment, thank you very much.
What's with the crowd, Officer?
The crew has started... placing bets, Captain. On whether she can keep it all down.

Fields.MenuText: That's horrible. Tell them the bets are off.
I'm putting fifty on her making it.
I'll put fifty on her throwing up all over the floor.

Fields.DialogueText: No, let 'em have their fun, Captain.
Thanks for the support, Captain.
So much confidence in me, Captain.
More fish! Bring 'em all to me right now!
*Cheers*
I'm going to take a step back.
That might be smart, Captain.
*Cheers*
She's like a beast.
She's treating this as seriously as a battle with the Morganas.
*nom nom gulp* Phew, done!
*ALARM*
I guess now it's time to work off all those meals.
Pf. This hardly counts as exercise at all.
@BATTLE
Suckers.
Pay up, then get to battle stations, people! Company should be almost in sight!
Boise, are you... doing pull ups?
Obviously.
But why are you doing them over the edge of the ship?
It raises the stakes. The more your blood is pumping, the more you're working out.

Fields.MenuText: Makes sense to me.
Could you stop anyway? You're making the some of the crew uncomfortable.
I'm not sure that's true.

Fields.DialogueText: Wanna join me?
Why? I'm not bothering anyone.
It is for me. That's all that matters.
... There are Morganas to the north.
That's the only reason I'm stopping.
And the crew should remember that I can float if I wish.
You... have a point. Let's go take care of those Morganas.
Sounds good to me.
@BATTLE
People are scared you'll fall.
I think I'll pass.
The crew's already terrified that *you're* going to go off the side and sink without a trace. Why make them even more nervous?
You have a point. Still, would you mind stopping?
Boise?
Boise, are you okay? You're looking...
... strangely thoughtful.
Captain, are you only making me fight the weak Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: Yes.
No.
Why?

Fields.DialogueText: I knew it. Why else would I still not have my first proper scar?
Hmmm, that's weird. Then why haven't they scarred me yet?
I still haven't gotten my first scar. I figured a strong Morgana would've given me one or two by now.
I've been waiting to get my first real scar for a while now. Something dramatic!
Personally, I'd count myself lucky for that.
Well, I'm not a weeny. Battlewounds are badges of honors that show off what you've been through. If anyone looks at me now, I'm just a babe that's never even seen a real fight.
If it's that important to you, I'm sure you'll get one. Just don't take any unnecessary risks. Okay?
I won't. Just, maybe we can fight stronger Morganas if we get the chance?
Sure.
*ALARM*
Ohhh, I hope these are tougher than the usual ones!
What a handful.
@BATTLE
Those are some scary looking knives.
They're scarier looking projectiles.
Whoa, careful where you're throwing those knives, Boise!
Why don't you watch where you're standing, Cap? I'm obviously practicing here.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, sorry to bother you, carry on.
I think you've practiced enough. Your wall has more holes in it than Swiss cheese.
Practicing your captain-killing skills?

Fields.DialogueText: Wait a second.
That's the problem - there shouldn't be that many holes.
Nah, I'm already an expert at that.
Actually, I could use your help. Could you just stand against that wall for a second?
This wall? The one with all the holes in it?
Mhmmmm.
I'm not an idiot.
Come on, I just need to raise the stakes a bit. I'll do better than ever. There's no way I'll hit you.
Somehow, I don't think getting your blood pumping will increase your precision.
Oh, yeah?
*FLING*
Boise! I just saw my entire life flash before my eyes.
I didn't hit you, did I?
*ALARM*
We'll talk about this later. For now, go practice your aim on the Morganas.
Look at that - you do have some good ideas.
@BATTLE
Besides, I'm relaxing. Which, as you yourself observed, makes me more likely to pick up on... hang on.
More likely to pick up on incoming Morganas. Heh.
Seriously, Boise, you've got some impressive muscles.
You know it. I could probably bench press this ship if I had to.
Okay, that's a little crazy.
You calling me a liar? I'll do it right now!

Fields.MenuText: What's all the ruckus about?
Boise, stop yelling! Any louder and you'll draw the Morganas straight to us.
Didn't I tell everyone not to anger the Boise.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm gonna lift the ship!
Let 'em come. I'll take 'em all on.
The Boise? I'm not some zoo animal!
This one's calling me a lying weakling!
I just said I didn't think she could lift the entire ship.
Well, I can!
*ALARM*
Good enough. I guess.
But I'll be watching for signs that you're not taking me seriously. Watching like a pissed-off hawk.
*shudder*
@BATTLE
I feel like I missed something.
Biting. My. Tongue. What's going on?
What's got you all riled up this time?
How about *we* concede that we don't know your upper limits, and for all we know you really can...
Good start.
... and *you* concede that getting the ship into water shallow enough for you to get your feet on the ground and your hands on the keel is more trouble than it's worth?
Fine.
Thank you.
*If* Cho concedes that if he pisses me off enough I'll do it anyway. And it'll work.
... I'm certainly not going to argue that you *won't.*
Captain, I could really use a hand here.
What's wrong?
One of the passengers we picked up keeps screaming something to me in French. He doesn't understand a word I say.

Fields.MenuText: I speak French. I can handle this.
I don't speak French. What am I supposed to do?
I don't speak the language, but I can try and fake it.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks a lot, Captain. He's right over here.
Maybe he'll respond better to the captain. He's right over here.
Ummm... I guess that could help. He's right over here.
Wait, what's Boise doing over there?
He's leaving. How did she do that?
Boise, what did you say to that man?
Oh, that guy? He just wanted to know where to find the head.
... That would actually be a useful phrase to know.
You can learn it when we're not being attacked by Morganas.
@BATTLE
Boise? Something you wanted to say?
Hey, Captain, I was wondering if we could stop somewhere for a little fishing soon.
That... wasn't exactly what I was expecting to hear.
*shrugs*

Fields.MenuText: Didn't you learn your lesson last time?
Great, I've been craving seafood lately.
Just as long as you don't bring back an entire school of fish.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I'll only keep a handful.
Perfect. And I promise I'll release most of them.
I know, I know. I learned my lesson.
Then we'll make port as soon as possible.
Great. Thanks a lot.
Oh, will you be joining me?
Maybe. You want the company?
Pft, no. I was just curious.
Ha! I knew you liked me.
Captain!
I didn't say anything!
What's that...? Oh, look to our north, Captain. We have Morganas headed this direction.
Right. Let's get ready for battle.
No need, I'm always ready.
@BATTLE
All right, today is the day!
Yeah, yeah, we'll believe it when we see it.
You can do it, Boise!
Hope everyone is ready for a show!
What's going on?
Boise's going to lift one of the Seagulls.
She's going to try.

Fields.MenuText: And no one thought to let the captain know the plane was about to be lifted?
DAMMIT, BOISE!
*sigh*

Fields.DialogueText: Well, honestly, no one really thinks she'll be able to do it.
... Well, this could get uncomfortable fast.
Yeah, that's fair.
Boise, I'm here to perform my duties as ship killjoy. Please step away from the plane.
But I can lift it!
... Ouch.
... Yeah, fair enough.
Morganas are incoming anyway.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I believe you.
I don't care!
Just stop.

Fields.DialogueText: Even assuming you can, that thing's fuselage wasn't engineered to be lifted from underneath by two hands.
And I don't want to have to explain how we cracked a floatplane in half because my crew was dumb enough to make bets with my Belle.
Are you okay?
How do you think I am?
Possessed of one more seaplane than you might otherwise have been?
Not helpful.
Sorry.
... That was just embarrassing.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you weren't the only one to blame.
Yeah, it was. You probably shouldn't show your face on deck for a while.
For what it's worth, I honestly think you would've lifted the damn thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, great pep talk, Cap.
Pft, I like it better in my room, anyway.
Heheh, I know you're just trying to make me feel better. ...It's working.
I'll get over it. I just need something to distract myself.
Something like?
Preferably? Morganas.
This would be the perfect time for the alarm to go off, huh?
Yeah, I was actually expecting it to. It would have been perfect.
Well... Life isn't perfect.
Yeah, but they're actually pretty close. The Morganas, I mean, not life.
*ALARM*
Finally!
@BATTLE
Caaaaaaptain!
What do you need, Boise?
I've been fishing way too much. I want to do something else.
Have anything in mind?
Well... I was thinking we could pick up a few harpoons and maybe take on a few whales, or sharks. It's the ocean's version of hunting!

Fields.MenuText: We might be able to do that.
I'm not sure that's such a good idea.
Great, now the ship's going to smell like rotting blubber.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Oh, yes! I'm excited!
Come on, it'll be fun!
That sounds like a yes to me!
Boise, I'm pretty sure if you actually wanted to harpoon a shark or a whale, you'd still have to leave the ship, at some point.
And we're not equipped to do anything with the carcasses anyway. If you want to swim around and try playing tag when you're off-duty, be my guest, but otherwise I don't see it working.
I've got a plan, Captain.
We can talk about it again when we don't have a Morgana almost in firing range, okay?
Pft, fine. I guess I can wait, then.
At least you'll have plenty of Morganas to fight in the meantime.
There's always a silver lining.
@BATTLE
It's pretty gorgeous out right now.
Nice and quiet. It feels like forever since I got a little time to breathe.
Speaking of... where's Boise?
I haven't seen her in a while.
... heheh...
What was that?

Fields.MenuText: A toy arrow?
Attack! We're under attack! Captain down! I've been shot!
(pretend like you didn't feel anything)

Fields.DialogueText: I got you, Captain!
Calm down! It's just a toy, Cap.
... That's odd... did I miss?
What are you doing, sneaking around like that?
I was hunting.
Me?
Nothing else to hunt on the ship. Unless you're open to the idea of setting a few wild animals loose.
No, thank you.
Captain, Boise, we've got Morganas inbound.
Just... stop shooting at me and start shooting at them.
With pleasure.
@BATTLE
I'm right here. Ha, I wasn't even trying to hide!
Boise! Don't do that! You practically gave me a heart attack.
Jeez, sorry. Didn't know you couldn't take a joke.
Ouch!
Boise, can you help load the supplies onto the ship?
Yeah, I guess, whatever.
Thanks.

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful not to break anything.
I really appreciate the help.
Go for the heavy stuff first.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, dang, you caught me. That was my plan all along.
You don't gotta be all... nice about it.
Tell me something I don't know.
What is all this stuff, anyway?
I don't know.
What? You bought it, though.
Sorry, I just don't know.
Wait... what are you playing at? Of course you know. Oh... will I like the contents of these boxes?
I don't know. ...Probably.
Wooooooooooooo! A harpooooooooon!
I'm not encouraging whale hunting - but, given your unique talents, I figure there's got to be a way we can let you target-harpoon as a sport and just retrieve the thing after you've...
Nope! I'm gonna catch me a great white!
But wouldn't it be more challenging to throw a bottle overboard and aim for that?
As training, you mean? Yeah, okay!
... You're not really listening to me right now, are you?
But only 'cause I like you!
All right! Target practice!
Careful with it! It's the only one I could get...
@BATTLE
Where's Boise?
Uhhh... She's under the ship.
You say that in a way that makes me think I don't want to hear more.
She grabbed one of the harpoons and said something about "spearfishing like nobody's ever spearfished before" and then jumped over the edge.
... Honestly, that's not as bad as I'd feared. Thank you.
Should I call for her to get back up here?

Fields.MenuText: No. Let her keep hunting. I think it's... kind of cute.
It's okay. It's best not to annoy her when she's playing with harpoons.

Fields.DialogueText: That's... one way of looking at it, I guess.
Thank you, Captain.
Well, Captain, that...
Tell me anyway.
